direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I was trying to get some other clothes... but... they wouldn't... they made me feel like shit... She can't go on.  Mr. Thomas politely glances at the money. He unfolds it, smoothes it and hands it back to her.  He sighs. He picks up the phone.  He dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (into the phone) Women's clothing. (beat) Bridget, please. Vivian is staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (cont'd) Bridget, hello, this is Barnard Thomas over at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.  Well, thank you, that's flattering.  I'd like to ask a favor of you.  I'm going to send someone over.  Her name is Vivian. She's a guest of ours.  A very special guest. He glances at Vivian.  With those simple words, he'd made her feel better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (cont'd) She's from out of town and she needs a little help in dressing. Perhaps you could help her out. Thank you very much.  She'll be right over. He sets the phone down and smiles patronizingly at Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (cont'd) There you are.  If you have any other problems, come ask for me personally.  I'm Mr. Thomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barney. She smiles mischievously. EXT. FORT OF LOS ANGELES - DAY A sleek corporate helicopter flies over the port. EXT. BUILDING ROOFTOP - DAY Edward, Vance, Stuckey and Jake walk toward the building's edge.  They look out over the empty shipyard as Vance describes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... this is the jewel in Kross's crown.  We can strip out all the heavy equipment.  Some of the cranes are very valuable overseas.  The Japanese are salivating for them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prime industrial property straddling the Port of Long Beach and Los Angeles.  It gives me a hard-on. Edward points toward one of the edges of the shipyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that long building over there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Storage, I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not with those smokestacks it's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me check. Vance pulls out a notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The real estate possibilities are endless.  Most of the yard we'll just level.  I talked to a couple of developers, under the table, of course, and they said -- EDWARD You what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I talked to some developers about the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of an idiot are you? You don't talk about this to anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're close friends, they'd never breathe a word -- STUCKEY (to Vance) Where did you dig this moron up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right, Jake, that was an incredibly stupid thing to do. It won't happen again, Edward. I'll pull him off the project immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't bother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have the time to bring someone new up to speed. Besides... (not unkindly, to Jake) You've already impressed everyone you need to, haven't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't happen again, Mr. Harris. Vance has found what he was looking for in his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is interesting.  That building is storage now, but it used to be a smelting plant.  They closed it down after World War II.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want our lawyers to check into the toxic waste licences on them right away.  I want to know if the permits are still valid and what kind of limits are on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, yes.  It's a long shot but if the permits are still in effect, they're worth a fortune. He turns away.  The other follow Edward back toward the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time's diner tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight o'clock.  Kross is bringing his son.  Very bright kid, watch yourself with him.  Who's this girl you're taking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one you know. INT. SAKS - SECOND FLOOR - DAY The elevator opens and Vivian walks out and surveys the room nervously.  She walks toward the women's clothing section. BRIDGET, a large friendly woman, spots her and quickly approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be Vivian. Vivian nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's look at you... She steps back, regards Vivian with a professional eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Where are you from, dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Georgia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No wonder.  For starts, you should know that hot pants are horrid, even when you do have the legs to carry them off.  What are your plans while you're in town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I might be going out to dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll want a cocktail dress then.  Turn.  You have a beautiful figure.  A little too out in the open but simply lovely.  Size six? Do you need shoes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno.  Do thigh high, leather boots go with a cocktail dress?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling out) Philip!  We'll need shoes! Bridget leads Vivian towards the racks of clothes.  She pulls out a dress.

direction.raw_text: Your uncle will like this.

direction.raw_text: They never are, dear. INT. HOTEL LOBBY - LATE AFTERNOON Mr. Thomas is behind the desk.  He looks up.  Vivian is standing there, a happy look on her face.  She holds up a garment bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (dryly) I rather hoped you'd be wearing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to get it messed. I got shoes too.  Wanna see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS That's all right.  I'm sure they're quite lovely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were real nice to me there. They treated me, y'know... nice. Thanks, Barney. Mr. Thomas tries not to wince at the familiarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS You're very welcome, Miss Vivian. She smiles at him.  He watches as Vivian turns and walks toward the elevator.  The provocative way her hips move just naturally attracts the attention of a MALE PASSERBY.  And the white gloved ELEVATOR MAN literally leaps to press the elevator button for Vivian who rewards him with a happy smile.  Mr. Thomas sighs. INT. PENTHOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON The phone is ringing Vivian enters.  She hurries to pick it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? The phone keeps ringing -- it has more than one line.  Vivian frantically punches buttons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Hello?  What?  Hello? INT. STUCKEY'S OFFICE - LATE AFTERNOON - INTERCUT Edward is in a private office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never answer the phone.  Ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tsk, believe me, this will be the last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you buy some clothes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a dress, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one?  Christ... I hope it's appropriate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very tasteful.  I think you'll especially like the zipper in the crotch. (silence) I'm -- joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hope so.  You'll get some more clothes tomorrow.  I'll be pushed for time so meet me in the hotel lobby at seven forty-five sharp.  Got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't "got it".  Even the farmboys back in Georgia come to the door when they're taking you on a date.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go by yourself then.  Where you taking me anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Rex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you'll approve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... all right.  I'll meet you in the lobby.  But only cause you're paying me to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. Vivian slowly sets the phone down.  The phone rings again. Vivian, very carefully, punches the flashing button and picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I told you not to answer the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooh! Edward hangs up.  He smiles to himself. Vivian bites her fingernails, looking nervous.  The doorbell RINGS.  Vivian looks up, startled.  She rises, moves to answer it. It's the Spanish MAID.  She nods politely at Vivian.

direction.raw_text: Housekeeping.  I come to turn down the bed.  5:00, I turn down the bed.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Housekeeping.  I come to turn down the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. The Maid enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a trick to it? INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - LATE AFTERNOON The Maid turns down the bedspread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all?  You just fold back the bedspread?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I also place las chocolates on the pillow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooh, I love those.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I leave extras, miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks!  Consuelo, are all rich people so lazy they can't do this on their own? Consuelo shrugs. INT. HOTEL LOBBY - LATE AFTERNOON Mr. Thomas is still behind the desk, working when a soft voice startles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barney. He looks up.  He sighs.  Vivian still hasn't changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS What is it, Miss Vivian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward is taking me to some fancy place for dinner.  The Rex.  Ever been there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS It's a bit beyond my... range, shall we say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, mine too.  Is it like, y'know, normal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS I think you'll find it normal enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will I like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS You'll like it fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Thanks, Barney.  You're the best. She turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Just mind which fork you use. Vivian turns abruptly back, a horrified look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fork? INT. HOTEL DINING ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON CLOSE ANGLE - PLACESETTING An elegant formal placesetting complete with a myriad of different size forks, spoons, stacked china plates and crystal glassware. ANGLE ON MR. THOMAS AND VIVIAN sit across from one another at a fully set table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS In fifteen minutes I can teach you everything you need to know to dine with the Queen.  First, as you pick up the knife you shift your fork to the left hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I always eat like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Either you're European or badly brought up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm... I vonder vich. (giggles)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Actually, some of the richest people I know have the worst manners.  Of course, Mr. Harris, being of old money, knows his way around a table.  All right now, pay attention please.  Salad fork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if they serve soup?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS They will serve salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what if they serve soup?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Then you use your soup spoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) I like steak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (picking up the appropriate utensil) Then you would use your--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steak spoon! (laughs) Mr. Thomas swallows his exasperation. WE PULL BACK from their table to reveal the cavernous, empty banquets room, each table is set and ready for the dinner service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Miss Vivian -- VIVIAN Maybe I'll just order a burger, Barney, that way I can eat with my hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Miss Vivian... there's a salon here in the hotel.  Instead of worrying unnecessarily about table manners, why don't you just have your hair done instead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Professionally? INT. SALON - LATE AFTERNOON Vivian sits in a salon chair.  The last customer, THANE, a young man of about twenty with his long hair pulled back in a pony tail, tilts her head one way and then another, eyeing her professionally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a friend who has a friend who does Cher's wigs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate him already. (a beat) All set?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... what a ya say we chop it all off and bleach the tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling?  Trust me. INT. HOTEL LOBBY - EVENING Edward enters and looks around the lobby.  No Vivian.  Annoyed. Edward crosses to a house phone and picks it up.  He's about to dial when:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Good evening, Mr. Harris. Edward looks at him blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Barnard Thomas, manager of the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, yes.  If you'll excuse me just a moment -- MR. THOMAS I have a message for you from your "niece", sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS The young lady staying in your room? Edward's eyes narrow.  He hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we both know she's not my niece. Mr. Thomas looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Does this hotel have any problem with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Mr. Harris, a guest of yours, is a guest of ours and shall be treated accordingly.  The young lady asked me to tell you that she is waiting for you in the lounge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. He starts towards the lounge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Very intriguing young woman, Miss Vivian. His tone stops Edward in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (cont'd) Have a good evening, sir. And off he goes, leaving Edward to wonder what the hell transpired during the afternoon. INT. HOTEL LOUNGE - NIGHT Edward enters the lounge.  He looks around, not seeing Vivian. And suddenly his eyes go back to... the beautiful girl with the beautifully styled hair in the beautiful black cocktail dress at the piano bar.  Edward tries to hide his surprise as Vivian rises, moves elegantly towards him.  She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late. Such a beautiful woman deserves an apology and so, without thinking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're forgiven. She waits expectantly.  He holds out an arm.  She takes it. INT. REX RESTAURANT - NIGHT Vivian comes out of the ladies room.  She walks forward past the MAITRE'D'S station.  She stops.  She takes a breath... and then walks forward. INT. REX - ANOTHER ANGLE - LOOKING DOWN Vivian moves down a marble starircase, through the elegant restaurant toward a far table.  Her beauty and natural grace draw approving stares.  She is like a queen moving through a ballroom. At a secluded table, Edward sits in conversation with two men. JAMES KROSS, in his early 70's, a bulky self-made millionaire industrialist.  Sitting next to him is his son and second in command, DAVID KROSS, a handsome man in his early thirties. All of them rise as Vivian comes to the table.  David Kross holds out Vivian's chair for her.  Surprised, she nods her thanks.  In front of her is an enormous placesetting.  She smiles down at the utensils, filled with confidence. Waiters have placed a delicate salad down in front of each of them.  Vivian proudly reaches for her salad fork.  But then she sees that Kross has picked up the fork closest to his plate and is digging into his salad with that. Vivian looks to see what Edward will do.  He doesn't seem interested in eating yet.  Neither does David Kross.  Feeling a sudden panic, Vivian puts her fork down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So young man, I understand you are trying to take over my company. A moment.  The abruptness of the question takes Edward back for a moment.  But then he almost smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't patronize me, Mr. Kross.  Our ages mean nothing here. Kross and David look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Harris, we know you've purchased at least twenty percent of our stock.  We also know you plan to file a formal bid for a majority share.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-five percent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Harris, I built Kross Enterprises myself.  I know every man who ever worked there by his first name.  I know their wives... and their children.  If your intention is to take over my company and turn it into a glorified real estate deal, think again. Edward, thankfully, now reaches for his salad fork and begins to eat.  Relieved, Vivian picks up hers.  They all eat for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you suggest, Mr. Kross? WAITERS approach, some to clear the salad plates, some to put down the next course.  Vivian, thinking she's got to finish, quickly stuffs her mouth with the rest of her salad.  She is reluctant to let the Waiter take her fork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would it take to buy our stock back?  Name your price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To get me in a mood to sell -- double what I paid.  But your company doesn't have enough capital right now to buy anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're on the verge of closing a large navy contract.  Double is ridiculous but we can assure you a healthy profit on your shares.  We would give you a promissory note...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not getting any navy contracts. Vivian can see that both father and son are stunned by this news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way you could know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I do know.  I also know your lines of credit are over-extended. If I don't buy your company, someone else will... (looking up) Ah, the escargot. Escargot are put down in front of everyone.  Vivian stares at them dubiously.  She picks up what she assumes is the next "right" fork.  She picks up a snail.  The two do not fit. Flustered, she doesn't know what to do.  No one else seems to be eating.  And now a Waiter comes and places escargot forks at each place.  Vivian picks it up with a sigh of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly, to the Waiter) Scume me, what are these things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bending to whisper) Escargot, mademoiselle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaning close to whisper) Snails. Vivian stares at them, horrified.  She, like James and David Kross, no longer seem interested in eating.  Edward eats with pleasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kross, I'm not here to sell you my stock.  On the contrary, I'm here to buy yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) You've got a lot of nerve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  What I have is a lot of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all about you, Mr. Harris. When you buy companies, they have a way of disappearing.  Even the pension funds are stripped clean. The last three companies you took over were cut up in so many pieces, widows were left without their retirement checks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calmly) What I did with those companies was perfectly legal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't question the legality of what you do.  It's your morality that makes me sick.  I will not allow my company to be raped by a man like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry now) It is not your company.  It's a public company.  And I am going to acquire it.  Either I buy from the other stock holders, or I buy from you. Vivian struggles with her escargot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I would suggest that you and your board cooperate with me, rather than fight a battle you don't have the ammunition to win. Vivian suddenly ZINGS her snail across the table.  Everyone looks to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slippery little suckers... Kross rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'll excuse me young lady, Mr. Harris... (turns to David) Deal with this, David, you know where we stand.  I need to go someplace and puke. He rises.  He exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Edward and Vivian) Men like my father built this country.  He was no saint.  He screwed people.  But for every guy he stepped on, he gave a hundred a good job. Edward is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems like a nice man. David looks at Vivian as if seeing her for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can reach an understanding on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so.  You should know we're going to fight you with every resource we have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what you have to do.  I don't take it personally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.  I take it all very personally. (to Vivian) Very nice meeting you, Vivian. David Kross gets up and leaves.  Vivian and Edward sit in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a beat) And that's the way the game is played.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some game.  Screwin' some poor slob out of his retirement. Edward says nothing.  But Vivian can see she's hit a nerve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snails for dinner.  No wonder everybody is in such a bad mood. A Waiter appears at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we ready for the next course, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Bring a check, please. INT. PENTHOUSE LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Edward's face is pensive and thoughtful as he stares out of the glass window down at the city lights.  He quickly drains his champagne glass.  Vivian moves to stand next to him. She refills his glass from the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. He drinks.  Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're upset, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upset.  No.  I never get upset about business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You liked the guy, though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whether I liked him or not is irrelevant.  It's business. There's no emotion involved in business... if you want to survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (excited) We're the exactly the same!  Kit keeps telling me don't get emotional when you turn tricks -- that's why no kissing -- it's too personal. The key is like you're saying, stay numb, don't get involved -- when I'm with a guy, I'm a robot, I just do it. (realizing what she's saying and quickly recovers) Except with you.  At your price I give my all... Edward laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's not talks about this heavy stuff.  Come on, relax. Vivian comes up behind him.  She begins to rub his shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That... is very good. A moment.  Edward is silent.  Turns him, unknots his tie, unbuttons his collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what we're gonna do in a little while then?  We're gonna call Domino's and have'm deliver a bigass pizza.  We're gonna eat it in bed.  We're gonna veg' out and watch television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Television?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's this box, it has pictures, sound.  You don't have to use your brain at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have work to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-uh.  No work. Smiling, she softly kisses his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) See... what you haven't figured out yet... She kissed his neck.  She fumbles with his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Is that while you're the boss everyplace else... I'm the one in charge here. She kisses his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You... just think you are. She starts to kneel down.  He stops her.  They stare at one another for a moment.  He releases her.  She smiles.  She starts to undress him. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - MORNING Vivian is asleep.  She turns over, slowly waking.  Her hand goes out to touch Edward and encounters nothing but empty bed. Vivian comes awake with a sudden start.  She look around momentarily frightened, not sure where she is.  Sighing with relief, she lies back down.  She sees Edward's American Express card on the pillow next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Wake up, Vivian.  Time to shop. Edward comes out of the bathroom and moves toward the bed. He is tying his tie.  Vivian sits up and ties it for him.  He smiles at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still don't understand why you only bought one dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't as much fun as I thought it was going to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know those cold bitches that work in those stores and try to intimidate you?  It works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was someone rude to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a little problem in one store.  I wasn't dressed right. I don't know what to say.  I don't belong there.  Maybe I'll just go back to Bridget.  She was cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, you belong wherever you are.  I don't care how you were dressed, they were the ones who were wrong, not you. Edward sits on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) People aren't going to respect you unless you respect yourself. (a beat) The next time someone is rude to you, you stare at them right here. He softly touches her, right between the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's an old trick I use, especially with bankers.  Works every time.  Will you try it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confidently) Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Kit... No answer.  She hears someone at the door.  She hangs up. Edward enters.  He is carrying a small case.  He stops at the sight of Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I look okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a small smile) Hmm... let's see... no, there's something missing. He holds up the small case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want you to get too excited... these are on loan... however... Vivian's jaw drops.  Edward is holding a diamond and ruby necklace in his hands, holds it as if it might melt if he breathed too hard.  Edward behind Vivian, fastens the necklace around her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is made for a princess. I think she'd approve of you wearing it tonight.  There. Come look. He leads her to a mirror.  She stares at her reflection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward, I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shush.  Of course you can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I lose it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if someone tries to steal it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll guard them and you with my life. EDT. BURBANK AIRPORT - DAY A limo pulls onto the tarmac at Burbank Airport.  A PILOT in a leather jacket and sunglasses hurries forward to open the limo door.  Edward -- now wearing evening clothes -- and Vivian climbs out of the limo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your plane is ready to go, Mr. Harris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plane? Taking her arm, Edward leads her across the tarmac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to go all the way to San Francisco in a limousine, do you?  I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you taking me!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To meet some friends.  Rudolpho, a poet... Benoit, a landlord... Mimi, a flower maker...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The opera. Up ahead is a waiting private jet, its engines already HUMMING. She is speechless.  Edward grins, loving the look on her face. EXT. BURBANK AIRPORT - DAY The corporate jet takes off down the landing strip. INT. CORPORATE JET - DAY Edward and Vivian are alone in the passenger lounge of the jet. Vivian can't believe the cabin.  It is a comfortable room featuring a long couch that curves across two walls, built in bar, television and stereo.  Edward is once again, going over papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never been on a plane before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you like it.  Now be quiet, I've really got to read these. Vivian fluffs her hair up.  She makes a happy, excited growling sound -- Rrrrr!  A wicked gleam comes to her eye. She walks over to Edward and stands in front of him.  He looks up.  She parts the thigh high slit in her gown to expose silken quarters.  She begins to unfasten the garters one at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, what do you think you're doing? Edward watches silk stockings slide down Vivian's lovely legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being quiet. She reaches out and gently caresses Edward's face.  Edward sets down his papers. EXT. SAN FRANCISCO - SUNSET The setting sun casts an incredibly glow over the city and the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You ever been in love with anyone? INT. CORPORATE JET - SUNSET Vivian is at the window, looking out.  She carefully puts her earrings back on.  She stares, mesmerized by the skyline, the golden gate bridge in the distance.  She turns.  Edward is buttoning his shirt.  He is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.  You're not paying me to ask you question like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian.  I'm paying you to be you.  Be you. (a beat) Have you?  Ever been in love with anyone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, besides Elvis? (turning back to the window) I'm a human being.  Sure.  Once. First time I ever ran away from home, I got as far as Atlanta. I met this boy.  He'd been with his parents on their way to Chicago.  They stopped at a gas station.  He went to the john. When he came back they'd split. We sorta started looking out for each other.  Aw, he was sweet. And boy, was he good looking, y'know, dark hair and eyes. The chicken hawks were on him all the time.  He hated that. Sometimes we'd find a safe place to crash nights and we'd curl up together and we'd talk about all these crazy things.  The two of us getting married someday. Having kids.  Stupid stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to him? A moment.  Vivian shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father found me.  Dragged me home.  I don't know why, he never seemed to like me much when I was there. (a bitter smile) 'Cept when he was drunk, then he liked me a whole lot. (a moment) I made it back to Atlanta a year later.  Andy was gone. Silence.  Vivian stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, but things sure look fine when you're sitting way up high. Edward moves close to Vivian and putting an arm around her shoulders, stares with her out at the view.  Vivian rests her head against him. EXT. SAN FRANCISCO OPERA HOUSE - NIGHT An airport limo pulls to a stop in front of the San Francisco Opera House.  The DRIVER walks around back and opens the passenger door.  Edward emerges and helps Vivian out. INT. S.F. OPERA HOUSE LOBBY - NIGHT Edward puts his hand on Vivian's elbow as they walk through the elegant lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people say that opera is an acquired taste, but I don't believe it.  You can always tell when someone goes to the opera for the first time.  They either love it or hate it.  Those who love it will always love it; those who hate it might come to appreciate it, but they'll never truly love it. Vivian is wide eyed as they walk past a beautifully lit fountain with several graceful statues in its center. Everywhere she looks she sees elegantly dressed WOMEN and prosperous looking MEN.  It makes her nervous.  Without realizing it, she raises a protective hand up to her necklace. She looks as if she suspects someone is going to step up and steal it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viv?  I really doubt if anyone here is going to try and grab it. Vivian reluctantly lowers her hands. INT. S.F. OPERA HOUSE LOBBY - ANOTHER ANGLE - NIGHT A crowd of PEOPLE mill around the lobby, heading toward their seats.  Vivian is aware of the looks she draws as she passes -- curious, even envious looks from the WOMEN, appreciative glances from the MEN.  Her hands again rises nervously to her necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all think you look very beautiful, Vivian. Vivian gives him a grateful look.  Relaxing, she lowers her hand from the necklace.  With a flourish, he offers his arm.  She takes it.  They start forward. INT. S.F. OPERA HOUSE BOX - NIGHT Edward and Vivian take their seats in a box high above the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's in Italian, how will I know what they're saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll whisper some of the main parts of the story to you.  But you'll be surprised how much you understand.  The music conveys the story more powerfully than any words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But don't they have it in English?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, don't be afraid of what you don't know.  That's the fun of it. The lights dim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (resigned) Okay.  Even if I hate it, I'm glad you brought me. The orchestra begins to play.  Vivian's eyes focus intensely on the stage, as if a new world is about to be revealed to her. INT. S.F. OPERA HOUSE STATE - NIGHT IN A MONTAGE OF IMAGES AND MUSIC - LA BOHEME is performed. The lights from the stage dance across Vivian's face.  Edward leans over to translate the tenor's aria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I?  I am a poet.  Not a man of wealth but one rich in dreams.  You have come to replace my vanished dreams.  I dwell now only in your eyes. The MUSIC ebbs and swells.  The sets and costumes change.  The story continues. Edward again leans close to Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now she asks Rudolpho if he still thinks her beautiful -- Vivian raises a hand and gently covers Edward's mouth.  Her eyes are fixed on the stage.  She doesn't need his help. The emotions building inside Vivian swell as the music is reaching its tragic climax.  Her lips tremble.  Her eyes fill with tears.  Edward glances at her.  He studies her a long moment, watching the emotions play unashamedly across her face. Strangely moved, he takes Vivian's hand. As the opera ends, they are both swept away by it. INT. S.F. OPERA HOUSE BOX - NIGHT As the lights come up, Vivian wipes off her tear-ruined mascara.  She sighs, happy.  The WOMEN in the next box smile at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you enjoy the opera, dear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tearfully) It was so beautiful I just about pissed my pants. Edward smiles at the now shocked looking Older Woman and he and the still misty Vivian exit. INT. CORPORATE JET - NIGHT - LATER Edward and Vivian sit side by side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd gone on about how much you liked it, I'm not sure I'd have believed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I more than liked it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I'm glad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: NIGHT IN A SERIES OF CROSS FADES

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I've never enjoyed it more. Thank you. Vivian looks at him a moment.  And then, leaning slowly forward she kisses him gently on the mouth.  He looks at her surprise. He puts his arms around her and kisses her back.  It is the first time they've kissed and they make it very special. EXT. CORPORATE JET - NIGHT The plane flies in the night.  Back to L.A. INT. REGENT BEVERLY WILSHIRE PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - NIGHT IN A SERIES OF CROSS FADES Edward and Vivian make love. Equally giving, equally taking.  No masks, no shields. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - NIGHT - LATER In the darkened bedroom, Edward and Vivian lie together. Edward cradles Vivian.  Her back rests against his chest.  His arm is over her body. She takes Edward's hand in her hands and carefully examines it; marveling at the fingers, the tiny hairs on the back.  She gently kisses the palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love you... She clutches Edward's hand tightly to her breast.  She closes her eyes, ready to sleep now. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - ANGLE ON EDWARD - NIGHT His eyes open.  Vivian's whispered endearment has filled with him with sudden confusion and uncertainty.  He stares into the dark, wondering what to do with the woman in his arms. INT. PENTHOUSE - OUTDOOR PATIO - MORNING The phone rings.  Edward immediately reaches out and picks it up.  He is dressed in a robe.  Breakfast is on the umbrella'd table in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? INT.  STUCKEY'S HOME - LIBRARY- MORNING - INTERCUT Stuckey, not even dressed yet, paces around his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I wake you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to call.  I jus got off the phone with James Kross.  Get this.  He wants to see you. Today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't say.  Edward... I think we got him.  His nuts are on the block and we got him. (silence) You there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me twenty minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be there.  Listen, if he's really caving in, we'll go from there down to the office.  I want him to commit his stock to us this morning. Edward hangs up.  His mind seems on other things.  He rises. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - MORNING Vivian is still asleep.  She is face down on the bed, the sheets just covering her to her waist.  Edward stares down at her.  He gently reaches out and runs a finger down the soft line of her spine.  Vivian murmurs contentedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmm. (opening her eyes; looking at him) Hi. Edward smiles at her softly.  And then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better get dressed.  We're having guests. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - DAY Vivian is wearing her yellow dress.  She stares at herself in the bedroom mirror.  Her hair... her make-up... she realizes how different she is now, realizes that she likes it. Edward comes out of the bathroom.  He crosses to the closet for a tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here.  Let me. She comes over, starts to tie his tie for him.  He is very aware of the closeness of her.  She smiles at him.  He smiles; puts his hand on her stopping her for a moment.  Looking up, she sees that he is serious now; no more jokes.  He releases her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) One more night and you're finally rid of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you've been pretty tough to take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to go to New York tomorrow. Vivian says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But I'll be back in Los Angeles. Soon.  I'd like to see you again. I thought we could work out something... An arrangement. Vivian is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'll get you an apartment, buy you a car -- Vivian sighs, letting something go inside.  Finished with his tie, she turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not unkindly) What else?  You gonna leave some cash by the bed when you pass through town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wouldn't be like that.  I want to get you off the street.  You'll have a different kind of life. What's wrong with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.  That's very sweet, Edward, and I know you mean it... She is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, I've thought about this a lot.  This is the best solution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes her head "no," then continues tying his tie) When I was a little girl, my mother locked me in the attic when I was bad, which was pretty often. I'd stare out the window up there and make believe I was a princess trapped in the tower by the wicked queen.  Then suddenly a knight on a white horse with his bright colors flying would ride up. Rescue me from the tower, and then we'd ride off... but never, ever in all the times I had that dream did the knight say, "Come on baby, I'll put you up in a great condo." She finished his tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, life's not a fairy tale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly; to herself) I know. (a beat) Hey, don't mind me.  I'm being stupid. (more) I'll think about it, okay?  It's a real good offer for a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never treated you like a whore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not mean) You just did. The doorbell suddenly rings in the living room. INT. PENTHOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY Edward enters the living room.  Vivian slowly enters behind him.  Edward opens the front door.  Mr. Kross slowly enters. He looks very old and tired; so much so that Edward has to mask his surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Harris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you, Mr. Kross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad for a man who hasn't slept in four nights.  I'll get used to it. An angry, reluctant looking David Kross is behind his father. Stuckey brings up the rear.  Edward and David give one another perfunctory nod.  Stuckey smugly winks at Edward.  Edward closes the door and leads them all down the stairs. Vivian is very troubled at Kross's appearance.  He gently nods at Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. (to David) Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not waste time here, shall we?  Mr. Kross, you said this morning, you wished to speak with Mr. Harris.  Mr. Harris is now listening. Kross has to fight down his humiliation at Stuckey's tone.  He turns to Edward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I'm here to tell you that I've reconsidered my position on your acquisition offer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Expected... offer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, yes.  After the expected filing period is over, I'm going to recommend to the board that we accept your bid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a moment) You're making the right decision, sir. Stuckey glances triumphantly at Edward.  He is surprised to see that there doesn't seem to be any victory in Edward's face. Edward is silent.  Kross interprets his silence as second thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you on one condition. I'm not so concerned for me but the people who have worked for me... Vivian is disturbed watching this tired looking man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly) They'll be taken care of.  Won't they, Edward? Kross ignores Stuckey.  He looks to Edward.  Edward slowly nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll sign anything you want then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today. Kross nods tiredly.  His voice is very soft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today. Vivian abruptly turns and disappears into the bedroom, obviously upset.  The men all watch her go.  Edward hesitates. He turns to Kross:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, please? He heads to the bedroom. INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - DAY Vivian is sitting on the bed, on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.  Is Kit DeLuca there? When she comes in will you have her call Vivian Wells at 560-30000. Yes.  Okay. She hangs up as Edward comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last time I saw him he was this strong guy.  Now he's beaten. And you liked him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, I want you to listen to me.  The man realized that it would be better for his future and his son's future, if he cooperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your concern.  It's... business, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  The man made a business decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all just business to you. Him.  Me.  Your life. Everything's business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what I do for a living. It's how I make money. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back in a few hours. We'll talk about this later. INT. PENTHOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY Edward enters the living room.  The men look at him expectantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll continue this down at the office. He heads for the door. EXT. PENTHOUSE PATIO - DAY Vivian stands at the railing, unhappily looking out at the city beyond.  The phone RINGS.  She turns and hurries inside. INT. PENTHOUSE LIVING ROOM - DAY Vivian answers the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lo? INT. HOTEL LOBBY - DAY - INTERCUT Mr. Thomas is standing behind the front desk, a rather strained expression on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Barnard Thomas here.  Miss Vivian, I wonder if you might come down to the front desk.  There's someone here to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS I'd send them up, but sadly, I don't trust the young lady to find you on her own. A hand reaches out and wrenches the phone away from Mr. Thomas. Kit, heavy make-up, skimpy outfit, chewing gum, cigarette and all, keeps her voice just below a bellow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viv?  Where are you, babe? (glaring at Mr. Thomas) The sphincter-police won't let me through. INT. HOTEL LOUNGE - DAY Kit finishes slurping on a big, frosty ice cream soda.  She smacks her lips like a happy, little girl.  Vivian isn't having anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm glad you're clean but I've been calling and calling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos.  I still owe him two hundred bucks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit, I left that money for you days ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  I just got it. An OLDER COUPLE walk past the table.  They stare at Kit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty bucks, grampa.  For seventy-five, the wife can watch. Horrified, the elderly couple hurry away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody keeps starin' at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I know what you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know?  You look good. All dressed up. (meaning it) You clean up real nice. (giggling) You sure don't fit in down on the Boulevard, lookin' like you do.  Not that you ever did anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I fit here where they just about chew your food for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you fit? Vivian is silent, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly) I kissed him, Kit.  On the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, you're not supposed to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I stopped pretending and started liking it with him for real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my god, you mean it was good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (miserably) It was great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dummy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants to set me up in a place, give me some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pray for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) All I'm doing is feeling lousy about it.  I don't know what to do.  What do I do, Kit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go for the bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about bucks. (a beat) I might love this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, are you in deep shit. (a sigh) You know he'll break your heart. Vivian is silent again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I blame myself here.  First time I laid eyes on ya', I knew you were too complicated to be a whore. Vivian nods.  Her face is filled with confusion. INT. BROKERAGE HOUSE - CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY Edward stands at the window looking out.  There is something about his somber demeanor that both reflects the look we've just seen on Vivian and suggests the way we saw him at the top of the story. Jake enters, a pile of papers under his arm.  He begins laying them out on the conference table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kross is just getting off the phone with his stock broker. It's finished.  You've won. Edward says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you going after next, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who indeed... He turns as Stuckey, James and David Kross, and Vance enter the room.  They surround a conference table.  Kross sits, the papers laid out in front of him.  Stuckey hands Kross a pen. A SECRETARY lays out finger food.  They wait for her to leave before they speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we can get these letters of intent out of the way now... Mr. Harris and I would like to ask you some questions about your company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad, excuse me, but that's inappropriate.  You're under no obligation to answer any questions at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could we at least wait till after the filing period? Stuckey glances to Edward for help.  Edward is silent; indeed it's as if something is twisting inside of him.  Stuckey plunges ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Harris is preparing a bid based on our speculation of the corporation's net worth.  The price he ultimately pays for your father's stock will be based on that bid.  The more we know, the higher our bid can be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's in my best interest to cooperate, David.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he throws himself on your sword, you promise to take care of him and his family, huh? David stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's unfair!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bed it is. (to Edward) You're everything he said you were. (to his father) Do what you have to do, Dad. Just don't expect me to watch it. He exits.  A moment.  Kross looks at Edward with a resigned smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's young.  He hasn't learned how to lose gracefully yet.  I'll sign your papers.  And I'll answer your questions.  Whatever you want. He sighs.  He picks up the pen.  He's about to sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop.  For just a moment. (a moment) Mr. Kross, I'd like to ask you a few questions before you sign. You realize that you're a target. If you weren't mine, you'd be someone elses, correct?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had a... reprieve, what would do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly) I don't think there's any sense in -- EDWARD Let him answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I would take advantage of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Kross looks uncertain.  He gropes for an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I don't know.  There... there wasn't time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you'd find out soon enough that you have assets you presently don't seem aware of, wouldn't you?  The waste processing licenses at that abandoned shipyard of yours, you'd certainly find out about that. Surprise suddenly flares in Stuckey's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my god... Edward, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you'd use them as collateral on new loans, wouldn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you lost your mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Stuckey) Quiet. (to Edward) Would I get the loans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time I imagine you would, yes. (as if thinking about it) Hmm... (a moment) With all this in mind, Mr. Kross, I can't logically make a formal bid on your company, can I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a small smile) You'd be initiating a financial battle you'd ultimately lose, Mr. Harris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very right.  I think the best thing we could all do is go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a good day, gentlemen. He exits from the room.  Stuckey follows. INT. BROKERAGE HOUSE - DAY Edward is walking down the hall.  Stuckey comes out of the office and calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calls) Edward, what happened?  What kind of move was that? Edward silently goes into the elevators.  The doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells) Dammit Edward, speak to me. Stuckey heads back to the conference room. EXT. OFFICE BUILDING - LATE AFTERNOON Edward comes out of the building.  His Chauffeur leaps to open the limo door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... take the car back to the hotel.  I need to walk. He sets off across Century Park East. INT. PENTHOUSE - EVENING Vivian is in the living room, pacing, edgy, the doorbell rings. She turns.  It rings again. She opens it.  Stuckey is standing outside with a small briefcase.  He looks agitated.  He tries to hide it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well... Hello again.  I'm looking for Edward. Vivian just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward's not back.  I thought he was with you. Stuckey walks past her and down the steps into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll just have to wait then, won't I? There is a bar set up.  Stuckey sets his briefcase down.  He crosses to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Mind if I have a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He pours liquor in a glass.  He fires it down.  It seems to calm him a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to know what he did? Do you want to know what the crazy son of a bitch did?  He handed the whole thing back to Kross! On a silver platter.  For no reason!  What was he thinking, I mean, what was going through his goddam head?  Why? (pours another drink) What was all that benevolent crap?  What are we going to become, a philanthropic foundation?  I'll probably be the director of several worthwhile charities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's great. Stuckey glares at Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet.  A lousy whore and you're the gum in a hundred million dollar deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mocking) Aw, come on, Bill.  It's just business. He looks at her a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what do I know, maybe you're worth it.  Come on, show me. Let's see your act. He grabs her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  I'll pay for it. What a you charge?  Huh?  Twenty, thirty, fifty bucks, maybe?  Are you a fifty dollar whore? He tries to kiss her and pulls her down on the couch on top of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? She bites his hand.  Stuckey slaps her.  Vivian starts flailing back.  But Stuckey is too strong.  Vivian staggers back at the force of another slap.  Stuckey slams her up against a wall and starts rubbing up against her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a mean streak in you, don't you. He tries to kiss her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Is that what he likes about you? Huh?  Answer me! And suddenly a HAND lands on Stuckey's shoulder.  Stuckey turns his head, startled. INT. PENTHOUSE - REVERSE ANGLE - STUCKEY'S P.O.V. Edward, murder in his eyes, belts Stuckey across the room. INT. PENTHOUSE - NIGHT - BACK TO SCENE Stuckey falls on the ground.  Edward rushes forward, berserk with rage, to hit Stuckey again.  His fist hits the top of Stuckey's head, hurting Edward's hand more than Stuckey's skull. Vivian rushes out of room to bathroom.  Again Stuckey tries to rise.  Edward kicks him in the butt, sends him headfirst into the bar.  Glasses and bottles CRASH to the floor.  Stuckey again tries to rise.  And collapses.  Edward rubs his fist.  They're not used to this violence and both stare at each other panting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You broke my nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I broke my hand. (a beat) You're fired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward, we've been together ten years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't like what we've become.  I'll cover any losses you have on this one.  Now get out, you asshole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this because of that whore!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Edward pushes Stuckey out the door and throws his briefcase after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward, think about what you're -- Edward slams the door in his face.  Edward stands there, reflecting on what he's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself, almost proud) Well, I didn't plan that! INT. PENTHOUSE BEDROOM - NIGHT - LATER Edward holds an icepack to Vivian's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do guys always know how to hit a woman?  Right across the cheek, wham, so it feels like your eye is gonna explode.  What do they do, take you all aside in high school and show you how? It pisses me off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not all men hit.  And no one is going to hit you anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. (softening) You're quite the Sir Galahad today, aren't ya'? (a beat) I heard what you did with Kross.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a business decision. Vivian looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got tired of hating my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a small smile) It was good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It felt good. Edward looks on the bed at her suitcases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're packing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) I'm leaving. (a moment) Don't ya see?  If I stay with you like you want me to, there'll always be some guy, your friends eve, treatin' me like that... thinkin' they're allowed to.  What are you gonna do, fight'm all? No.  I'll take my money now, please. A moment.  Edward reaches for his wallet.  He counts out bills. He places them in Vivian's suitcase.  He puts his arms around Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, don't... no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay with me tonight.  Not because you're being paid to. Stay with me because you want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do.  I do want to.  That's why I'm leaving. (turning to him) That's what you given me, see? I know what I want now.  I want a guy like you for real.  Not because you buy me things and give me money.  The nicest thing you ever done for me is hold my hand. You gonna give me that? Edward is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your fault.  You're right.  Kit's right. (looks him right in the eye) But I want the fairy tale. INT. HOTEL LOBBY - EVENING Vivian comes out of the elevators.  A BELLMAN sees her and springs forward, reaching for her bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me take those, miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Vivian sees Mr. Thomas behind the front desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be out front in a minute. I got a cab comin'. The bellman moves away.  Vivian walks to the front desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Barney!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS (looking up) Miss Vivian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look I just wanted to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Mr. Harris doesn't check out until tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, I check out today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS You're not accompanying him to New York?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lightly) Come on, Barney, you and me live in the real world. (a beat) You don't know how to treat a girl like anything but a lady, Mr. Thomas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THOMAS Certain ladies make that very easy... Vivian. (turning to the desk clerk) John, call a limousine for our guest, please.  Have it take her anywhere she wishes to go.  Bill the hotel. (turning back to Vivian) See you again sometime soon. Vivian smiles softly at him.  She turns and walks for the door. EXT. HOLLYWOOD BLVD. - DAY A long silver limo drives down Hollywood Blvd. INT. LIMO - DAY The LIMO DRIVER pushes the button that rolls down the screen between back and front seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sure this is the right street, ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. 1312.  It's a big apartment building. EXT. VIVIAN'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY The limo pulls to a stop in front of a rundown apartment building on a dirty Hollywood side street.  The Limo Driver, a large Latino man, steps out of the car and walks around to the passenger door.  As he does, he surveys the surroundings uncomfortably.  Ths is rough neighborhood.  He opens the door. Vivian steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should go with you.  This doesn't look like a good place for a lady to be alone. Several PEOPLE pass.  All of them stare at the car, at the driver, at Vivian in her lovely clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be okay.  I'm home.  Thank you. The driver, confused, watches her hurry up the steps to the apartment building.  He drives off. INT. APARTMENT LOBBY - DAY Vivian walks toward her apartment.  The Landlord is sitting at the front desk in a dirty undershirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we announce guests here. You a relative of somebody? Vivian lowers her sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Viv -- is that you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's me. She keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lookin' good, Viv'.  Nice threads.  I gotta find time to shop. INT. PENTHOUSE - DAY Edward stands at the penthouse window, looking out.  He is dressed now, ready for travel.  There is something about his expression, his somber demeanor that suggests the way we saw him at the very top of the story.  A BELLMAN enters from the bedroom, rolling a luggage loaded dolly along in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that everything, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning from the window) That's everything. The Bellman exits, closing the door behind him.  The phone rings.  Edward crosses to it, picks it up.  The Maid comes in, looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lady, she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  She go. INT. HOTEL LOBBY - DAY Edward with the Bellhop heads to the front door.  He's leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a car taking you to the airport, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. INT.  VIVIAN'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - DAY Vivian, looking fresh scrubbed without make-up, is wearing clean jeans, a nice looking shirt and a suit jacket.  Her bureau's are open.  She is packing.  Kit is watching.  She takes the photo of her and Kit dressed up hot in hooker clothes and packs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So whatta' you going to do in San Francisco?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a job and probably go back to school.  Figure out what I'm gonna be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: School, school.  Regular.  I used to get pretty good grades in school, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did I.  I made it with the principal. (recites) Study hard And get a "B."  Lift your dress and an "A" you'll see. They both laugh but too hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want a pair of boots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I!?  Momma! Taking them, she sits on the bed and puts them on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you won't come with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And leave all this?  Not in a million. They laugh together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) What time's your bus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couple a hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Well... I gotta split. Goodbye's make me crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool your jets a second. (going to her purse) Here's some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  You took care of rent, that's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to.  For food, got it? Eat something before the wind blows you away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna pay you back next time I see ya, babe.  Just wait, I'm gonna do something real nice for you some day. They hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Shit, I'm gettin' all weepy now. Kit begins backing out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Take care of you, okay?  Take care of you.  Love ya... Kit turns and hurries out of the apartment. EXT. HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD - DAY Kit enters the falafel stand on Hollywood Boulevard. INT. FALAFEL STAND - DAY Kit enters, sits at the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee, Chan.  And maybe a grilled cheese on white, okay? A very young GIRL is sitting just down the counter from Kit. Kit nods at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how you doin'.  You new, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Got a cigarette?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. She passes the girl down the pack.  She strikes a match, lights her cigarette for her.  The girl inhales deep, lets it out with a sigh.  She looks towards the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeez, did the wacko in the suit. Kit turns to look. KIT'S P.O.V. - HOLLYWOOD BLVD. Outside, across the street, Edward has accosted two PROSTITUTES; one blonde, one a red haired black one. INT. FALAFEL STAND - DAY - BACK TO SCENE Kit rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chan?  Keep the sandwich warm, I'll be back. She heads out the door. EXT. HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD - DAY Edward is still talking to the prostitutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for a girl, Vivian, young, dark hair, big eyes...? They shake their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's mouthy.  Sort of difficult...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't seen her, wouldn't know her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with us, man?  Two for the price a one, what ya say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (disappointed) Thank you.  No. They turn and walk away.  Edward stands there, not knowing what to do next.  He looks discouraged and lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Edward Harris, as I live and breathe! Edward quickly turns to find Kit staring at him.  Kit smiles, triumphantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Yeah.  Boy, you're just like she said. She turns and starts away.  She stops, turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You comin' or not?  I don't got all day, I got a grilled cheese waitin'. Edward follows Kit. INT.  VIVIAN'S APARTMENT - DAY Vivian sits on her bed, lost in thought.  Her bags are packed, ready to go.  With a sigh she rises.  She picks up the bags, exits the room. Vivian stands in the dreary living room, looking at it, taking it all in for the last time.  She suddenly looks more than a little bit frightened to be leaving.  She musters resolve.  She goes to the door, opens it and exits, closing it behind her. Silence.  Vivian suddenly comes back in.  She puts down her bags.  She crosses to the kitchen where she takes coffee can/piggy bank from the shelf.  She puts some more bills into it, places it back where Kit will find it. She turns and starts again for the door. She stops.  She hears something.  MUSIC.  An aria from La Boheme.  Faint.  Seemingly coming from nowhere.  She dismisses it -- she's hearing things.  She opens the door.  Stops.  The music is louder and getting louder now -- it's not her imagination.  She hurries over to the window. EXT. VIVIAN'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY Vivian comes out onto the fire escape.  She stares in wonder. A snow white limo comes up the street.  A necktie has been tied to the antennae like a knight's token.  The MUSIC from La Boheme is BLARING from the car's stereo.  Edward is standing on the car's seat, his head and body up through the open sunroof.  The wind blows at his hair.  He is smiling. Everywhere on the street people are staring; the BUMS, the PUSHERS, the PASSERBY'S, the TOURISTS. Vivian doesn't know whether to laugh or cry. The car comes to a stop in front of the Vivian's building. Vivian's landlord comes out the front door.  His eyes go wide in disbelief. Edward disembarks from the limo by coming up through the sunroof.  He leaps nimbly to the ground.  He crosses to the entrance of the alleyway, looking up at Vivian on the fire escape.
direction.name: direction
